question: You might hear a loud horn on the golf course if there is a risk of thunder and lightening. What do you need to do?*

choices.text: You can continue with your round unless you see lightning
Stand under a tree for shelter
You should mark your ball, pick it up and walk back to the club house

explanation: If play is suspended (with blasts from a horn), you have to stop playing. Mark your ball and go to the clubhouse. You are allowed to complete a hole but should only do so if it's safe. Do not take shelter under a tree though, it's one of the MOST DANGEROUS places you can stand when there is lightning.
